# Toll Brothers (TOL) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Toll Brothers, Inc. is an American homebuilding company that builds, markets, and finances for residential and commercial properties in the United States. It designs, builds, markets, sells, and arranges finance for a range of detached and attached homes in luxury residential communities. In 2020, the company was the fifth largest home builder in the United States, based on homebuilding revenue. The company is ranked 411th on the Fortune 500.

Toll Brothers holds a significant position in the luxury homebuilding sector, recognized as 'America's Luxury Home Builder.' Today, we operate in over 60 markets in 24 states and Washington, DC. We continue to grow in our current markets and may expand into new markets by establishing our own operations or acquiring home builders.

The company differentiates itself through its vertically integrated business model, in-house design studios, and a commitment to craftsmanship and architectural innovation. These factors allow Toll Brothers to provide a unique blend of luxury, quality, and personalized service. A key aspect of how Toll Brothers operates is its 'build-to-order' approach, allowing extensive home personalization. In fiscal year 2024, buyers added an average of $203,000 in lot premiums and design options.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of TOL is 144.92 USD — it has decreased by −1.79% in the past 24 hours. As of today, Toll Brothers(TOL) shares are valued at $144.26. The company's market cap stands at 13.77B, with a P/E ratio of 10.74 and a dividend yield of 67.6%. The stock's 52-week range extends from a low of $86.67 to a high of $151.10.

According to 16 analysts, the average rating for TOL stock is "Buy." The 12-month stock price target is $154.81, which is an increase of 6.09% from the latest price.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

Toll Brothers offers a comprehensive portfolio of residential products and services:

**Residential Products:**
• Single-family homes, luxury single-story living and first-floor primary bedroom suite home designs, communities with recreational amenities, such as golf courses, marinas, pool complexes, country clubs, and fitness and recreation centers; and develops, operates, and rents apartments.
• Single-family, carriage house/townhouse and condominium residences, rental apartments (Apartment Living division) and luxury student housing (Campus Living division).
• Condominiums through Toll Brothers City Living.

**Ancillary Services:**
• Architectural, engineering, mortgage, title, land development, insurance, smart home technology, landscaping, lumber distribution, house component assembly, and component manufacturing operations.
• By operating its own architectural, engineering, mortgage, title, land development, insurance, smart home technology, and landscaping subsidiaries, the company captures additional revenue streams from its homebuyers.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

We continue to grow in our current markets and may expand into new markets by establishing our own operations or acquiring home builders. Similarly, we have expanded our product lines and customer base.

Community Count Expansion: The company aims to grow its community count by 8% to 10% in the coming year, banking on new openings and selective land acquisition. Community count expected to grow 8–10% by year-end 2026, with period-end count of 480–490.

Recent community launches include:
• New collections at Sterling Grove in Surprise, Arizona stand out as closely tied to that catalyst. They extend Toll Brothers' presence in a large, master planned setting, add mid US$400,000s to low US$500,000s price points, and lean into quick move-in and resort-style amenities.
• The launch of Coldwater Ridge in Northville, Michigan, stands out for its entry-point pricing and modern features, underscoring Toll Brothers' push into affluent yet accessible regions.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Toll Brothers' growth strategy centers on several key pillars:

**Market Expansion:**
With well-located land holdings, distinctive luxury home designs that appeal to a broad range of home seekers, and a business model that blends quick move-in and build-to-order homes that meet the needs of modern buyers looking for personalized spaces that suit their lifestyle, we are strategically positioned for continued growth.

**Land Acquisition Strategy:**
With 74,700 controlled lots—55% of which are optioned to reduce capital exposure—Toll Brothers has secured a land pipeline sufficient for growth through fiscal 2026 and beyond.

**Product Mix Evolution:**
Toll Brothers has shifted in recent years to a greater mix of speculative, or "quick move-in" homes. The homebuilder has also expanded its price points, with a greater emphasis on "affordable luxury.

**Multifamily Exit Strategy:**
CEO Douglas Yearley announced a strategic exit from the multifamily business and adopted a conservative outlook, stating 'We are not assuming any market improvement in our forecast.' Toll Brothers also plans to close its more than $300 million sale of Toll Brothers Apartment Living to Kennedy Wilson Holdings in the first quarter of next year.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

It serves luxury first-time, move-up, empty-nester, active-adult, and second-home buyers. Over 70% of the Toll Brothers' business serves the move-up and empty-nester segments, with the remainder focused on affluent, older, first-time buyers.

20% of our clients were all cash. This quarter was 25%. [Our buyers say:] 'I have the money. I'm wealthy, and I don't love a 7.5% rate. So, I'll put more of my own money to work and less of the bank's money to work.' Our LTV has gone from 70%, it is for those that do get a mortgage to 68%.

"Our luxury business is differentiated as we serve a more affluent customer who is less impacted by the affordability pressures that continue to impact the broader housing market," said Chairman and CEO Doug Yearley, Jr.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Fiscal Year 2025 Results (Ended October 31, 2025):**
• We delivered 11,292 homes at an average price of $960,000, generating a record $10.8 billion of home sales revenues, and posted an adjusted gross margin of 27.3%, an SG&A margin of 9.5%, and earnings of $13.49 per diluted share.
• Net income was $1.35 billion and earnings per diluted share were $13.49, compared to net income of $1.57 billion and earnings of $15.01 per diluted share in FY 2024.

**Q4 2025 Highlights:**
• Home sales revenues were $3.41 billion compared to $3.26 billion in FY 2024's fourth quarter; delivered homes were 3,443 compared to 3,431 in FY 2024's fourth quarter.
• Net income was $446.7 million and earnings per diluted share were $4.58 compared to net income of $475.4 million and earnings of $4.63 per diluted share in FY 2024's fourth quarter.

**FY 2026 Guidance:**
• Fiscal 2026 guidance: 10,300–10,700 home deliveries at an average price of $970,000–$990,000. Adjusted gross margin expected at 26% for the year; SG&A projected at 10.25% of home sales revenue.
• $650 million in share repurchases planned for 2026, mostly in the second half.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Current Industry Headwinds:**
• Market conditions remain challenging with two-thirds of builders reporting they are offering incentives to move buyers off the fence. However, builders continue to face supply-side headwinds, as regulatory costs and material prices remain stubbornly high.
• That shift undermines the industry's most comfortable assumption—that structural demand is predetermined. Still, they are weakened by the reality that many middle-class families cannot afford even the basics, let alone a new home, given rising insurance premiums, higher taxes, and an increasingly unaffordable household cost structure.
• Elevated mortgage rates earlier in the year have restrained buyer demand and weighed on home building activity, alongside persistently high construction costs.

**Toll Brothers-Specific Tailwinds:**
• However, luxury buyers remain relatively insulated. For example, ultra-wealthy clients are leveraging stock market gains to fund purchases.
• Maintains 27.1% gross margin and 11,292 homes delivered, outperforming peers amid industry-wide 5% revenue contraction. Strategic exit from multifamily and focus on coastal markets with 96% cash transactions insulate from mortgage rate volatility.

**Future Industry Outlook:**
• In early 2026, the U.S. housing industry is expected to witness improvements on the back of declining mortgage rate trends and the optimism surrounding the new policies under the current government.

## 9. Market Shares

KB Home (2.1%), Taylor Morrison (1.9%), Century Communities (1.6%), and Toll Brothers (1.6%) round out the top 10 builders for 2024. This places Toll Brothers as the 10th largest homebuilder by market share nationally.

However, in the luxury segment specifically, While public peers – the ones that count on 25% to 40% of their sales going into an ever-more-challenging entry-level segment – compete in a crowded arena right now, Toll Brothers can forage for present and future opportunity "far from the madding crowd."

Toll Brothers has the highest average sale price — $972,000 as of Q4 — of any public homebuilder nationally, and is using this to their advantage.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Primary Competitors:**
• D.R. Horton, TRI Pointe Homes, Taylor Morrison Home, PulteGroup, and Meritage Homes are some of the 8 competitors of Toll Brothers.

**Revenue Comparison (2024):**
• D.R. Horton reported a 2024 revenue of $33.8 billion.
• Lennar achieved a 2024 revenue of $33.8 billion.
• PulteGroup generated $17.3 billion in revenue in 2024.
• Toll Brothers closed 10,813 homes in 2024, generating $10.6 billion in revenue.

**Competitive Positioning:**
Taylor Morrison was recognized as the most trusted home builder in the 2025 America's Most Trusted Home Builder Study, where Toll Brothers secured third place.

While competitors like Tri Pointe Homes and Beazer Homes are pivoting toward higher-priced communities, Toll Brothers' brand equity and geographic footprint give it a distinct edge.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Acquisition Activity:**
Toll Brothers's most recent acquisition is StoryBook Homes, a Online listing platform for residential properties, acquired in August 2021. Toll Brothers has completed 7 acquisitions so far.

**Strategic Partnership:**
Toll Brothers also plans to close its more than $300 million sale of Toll Brothers Apartment Living to Kennedy Wilson Holdings in the first quarter of next year.

**Leadership Transition:**
Toll Brothers recently announced a planned leadership transition, with long-serving Chairman and CEO Douglas C. Yearley, Jr. set to move to Executive Chairman in March 2026 and Executive Vice President Karl K. Mistry, a 22-year company veteran, appointed to become CEO and join the Board on the same date.

## 12. Recent Developments

**Q4 2025 Earnings Results (December 8, 2025):**
Toll Brothers missed Q4 2025 EPS ($4.58 vs. $4.89 forecast) but exceeded revenue expectations ($3.42B, +3.32%), causing stock to decline 3.02% pre-market to $132.08. Company reported record fiscal 2025 home sales revenue of $10.8B (+3% YoY) with 11,292 homes delivered and 27.3% adjusted gross margin, maintaining strength in luxury segment.

**New Community Launches (2025-2026):**
• Toll Brothers, Inc. has recently announced a series of significant product launches and expansions, including new luxury home communities in Michigan, California, Texas, Nevada, Florida, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, and Washington, as well as the debut of a student housing community in Orlando, Florida. This wave of new offerings highlights the company's broadening presence in high-demand regions.

**Recognition:**
In 2025, Toll Brothers marked 10+ years in a row being named to the Fortune World's Most Admired CompaniesTM list** and the Company's Chairman and CEO Douglas C. Yearley, Jr. was named one of 25 Top CEOs by Barron's magazine.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Rating: 7.2/10**

**Rationale:**
Toll Brothers represents a compelling investment opportunity for growth-oriented portfolios with moderate risk tolerance, particularly given its dominant position in the luxury homebuilding market. The company's focus on affluent buyers provides significant insulation from broader economic headwinds affecting the housing market.

**Key Investment Strengths:**
• **Market Position**: Clear leader in luxury homebuilding with highest average selling prices ($972,000) among public builders
• **Financial Resilience**: Maintained 27.3% adjusted gross margins despite industry-wide challenges
• **Cash-Rich Customers**: 25% of buyers pay all-cash, reducing mortgage rate sensitivity
• **Strategic Focus**: Exit from multifamily business allows capital concentration on core luxury operations
• **Growth Pipeline**: 74,700 controlled lots with 8-10% community count expansion planned

**Key Risks:**
• **Economic Sensitivity**: Despite affluent customer base, still exposed to broader economic downturns
• **Margin Pressure**: Rising construction costs and material prices creating ongoing pressure
• **Spec Inventory Risk**: Increased reliance on speculative homes creates inventory risk if demand softens
• **Leadership Transition**: CEO succession planned for March 2026 adds execution uncertainty

**Fair Value Estimate: $165-175 per share**

Based on the company's strong market position, consistent cash generation, and strategic advantages in the luxury segment, combined with current market multiples and growth prospects, we estimate a fair value range of $165-175 per share. This represents approximately 14-21% upside from current levels around $144, justified by:

- Forward P/E multiple of 11-12x based on normalized earnings
- Premium valuation warranted by luxury market position and margin stability  
- Growth potential from community expansion and market share gains
- Strong balance sheet supporting capital returns and reinvestment

The rating reflects confidence in Toll Brothers' ability to outperform peers through economic cycles while acknowledging near-term headwinds facing the broader housing market.
tldr_summary:
Toll Brothers is a leading luxury homebuilder in the United States, designing and constructing high-end residential properties across 24 states with a focus on personalized, premium housing. The company distinguishes itself through a vertically integrated business model, targeting affluent move-up and empty-nester buyers with an average home price of $972,000 and a strong cash-buyer demographic (25% all-cash transactions).

Key investment considerations include its robust market position in luxury housing, strategic land holdings of 74,700 controlled lots, planned 8-10% community count expansion, and resilience to broader economic pressures. Notably, Toll Brothers is exiting the multifamily market to concentrate on luxury residential development, maintains strong gross margins around 27%, and operates in high-demand coastal and sunbelt markets with minimal mortgage rate sensitivity.

With an AI investment rating of 7.2/10 and estimated fair value of $165-175 per share, Toll Brothers presents an attractive opportunity for investors seeking exposure to premium residential real estate with defensive characteristics.
